10
A PHASED DEVELOPMENT OF A NATIONAL PUBLIC RADIO SYSTEM
For reasons previously set forth, it is proposed that the
National Public Radio System be developed by phases. The result
would be more program service for more stations and their
listeners.
The phasing would provide a pattern of expansion that should
be consistent with the resources available to the Corporation
for Public Broadcasting.
The time frame proposed:
I. Planning Phase
II. Initial Operation
III. Limited Operation
IV. Increased Operation
V. Expanded Operation
VI. Extended Operation
Date to 30 June 1969
1 July 1969 to 30 Sept. 1969
1 Oct. 1969 to 31 Dec. 1969
1 Jan. 1970 to 31 Mar. 1970
1 Apr. 1969 to 30 June 1970
1 July 1970 to 30 June 1971
(3 months)
(3 months)
(3 months)
(3 months)
(12 months)
Two assumptions are made in putting forth the phased concept.
First, that interconnection costs will be available to NPRS at
free or reduced rates for variable periods of broadcast. (PreÂ¬
